result.execSummary:
The defendant Delon A Bracey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
No use or possession of firearms.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Delon A Bracey in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Student Intern Matt Adrian under the supervision of  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties.  
As to Count 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit of 2 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- No use of prossession of firearms.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- No violent contact with T.B.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Defendant Delon A Bracey in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for plea and sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant advised No Violent Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Tonya B. and Tonya's storage locker located at 4565 N Green Bay Ave., Milwaukee, WI.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered previous bail conditions continue.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Delon A Bracey in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next date. Case adjourned in branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 11/02/2015. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, WCS Report.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order. Court orders the No Violent Contact order.

Defendant Delon A Bracey in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tonya B and Tonya's storage locker located at 4565 N. Green Bay Avenue, Milwaukee 53209.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Delon A Bracey in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Delon A Bracey in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj

Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
